etomica.graph.model

Interface Bitmap

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Bitmap>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBitmap, BitmapOfLong, BitmapOfLongVector

    public interface Bitmap
extends java.lang.Comparable<Bitmap>
    Abstracts away the form in which bitmaps implement their operations and store their data.

    • Method Detail

      • and

        void and(Bitmap other)
        and: bitmap -> bitmap = (bitmap & other). Assumes the bit length of the other bitmap is AT LEAST as large as the bit length of this bitmap.

      • bitCount

        int bitCount()
        Returns the number of bits set in the bitmap.

      • bitSize

        int bitSize()
        Returns the length in bits of the bitmap.

      • clearBit

        void clearBit(int bitIndex)

      • comparableInstance

        Bitmap comparableInstance(Bitmap other)
        Returns a bitmap instance with the same number of bits as this bitmap. If other has fewer bits than this bitmap, the output bitmap is 0-padded and has the same integer value as other. If other has more bits than this bitmap, the output bitmap is the result of truncating the highest bits of other.
        Returns:
        copy of the this bitmap

      • copy

        Bitmap copy()
        Creates an instance-compatible copy of this bitmap. This bitmap and the returned bitmap are both instances of the same class.
        Returns:
        copy of the this bitmap

      • copyHighest

        Bitmap copyHighest(int numBits)
        Creates an instance-compatible copy of highest numBits bits of this bitmap. This bitmap and the returned bitmap are both instances of the same class.
        Returns:
        copy of the this bitmap

      • copyLowest

        Bitmap copyLowest(int numBits)
        Creates an instance-compatible copy of lowest numBits bits of this bitmap. This bitmap and the returned bitmap are both instances of the same class.
        Returns:
        copy of the this bitmap

      • dec

        void dec()
        Decrements the integer value of this bitmap by one: bitmap--.

      • defBit

        void defBit(int bitIndex,
            boolean value)

        void flipBit(int bitIndex)

        Increments the integer value of this bitmap by one: bitmap++.

      • lsb

        int lsb()

      • lub

        int lub()

      • nand

        void nand(Bitmap other)
        Updates this bitmap with the result of the bitwise AND with the other bitmap: bitmap = ~(bitmap & other). Assumes the bit length of the other bitmap is AT LEAST as large as the bit length of this bitmap.

      • not

        void not()
        Inverts the bits of this bitmap: bitmap = ~bitmap.

      • or

        void or(Bitmap other)
        Updates this bitmap with the result of the bitwise AND with the other bitmap: bitmap = (bitmap | other). Assumes the bit length of the other bitmap is AT LEAST as large as the bit length of this bitmap.

      • setBit

        void setBit(int bitIndex)

      • setBits

        void setBits(boolean value)

      • testBit

        boolean testBit(int bitIndex)

      • xor

        void xor(Bitmap other)
        Updates this bitmap with the result of the bitwise AND with the other bitmap: bitmap = (bitmap ^ other). Assumes the bit length of the other bitmap is AT LEAST as large as the bit length of this bitmap.

      • toNumberString

        java.lang.String toNumberString()
        Returns a string for the integer represented by this bitmap
